articles.author: Brian Thevenot
articles.description: Investigators in New Orleans were searching for what motivated a U.S. Army veteran flying an ISIS flag from his truck to plow into a crowd of New Year's revelers, killing 15 people and injuring 30 more before dying in a shootout with police.
articles.title: Police probe motive in New Orleans truck rampage

articles.author: Ronda Churchill, David Shepardson, Karen Brettell
articles.description: Gasoline canisters and large firework mortars were packed into the Cybertruck that burst into flames.
articles.title: FBI looks for any link between Tesla explosion and New Orleans attack

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin, Jihoon Lee
articles.description: Investigators to seize materials related to aircraft maintenance and operation of airport facilities.
articles.title: South Korea police search Jeju Air, airport operator over fatal plane crash

articles.author: Hyun Yi
articles.description: The impeached president faces an attempt by authorities to arrest him over his short-lived Dec. 3 martial law.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon, facing unprecedented arrest over martial law, vows to 'fight until end'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A gunman who killed at least 10 people in a rampage in a small town in Montenegro died from self-inflicted injuries on Thursday after attempting suicide, the country's interior minister, Danilo Saranovic, said.
articles.title: Suspect in Montenegro shooting dies after attempting suicide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 10 Palestinians in a tent encampment sheltering displaced families in southern Gaza strip early on Thursday, medics said.
articles.title: Israeli airstrike kills at least 10 in southern Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Elon Musk looks likely to host the leader of the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party ahead of Germany's Feb. 23 national election in a live interview on X, his social media platform.
articles.title: Musk likely to host German far-right leader for online chat

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Alexander Tanas
articles.description: The cutting of Russian gas supplies to Moldova's breakaway Transdniestria region has forced the closure of all industrial companies except food producers, an official said on Thursday.
articles.title: Starved of Russian gas, industry shuts down in breakaway Moldovan region

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Do Kwon, the South Korean cryptocurrency entrepreneur behind two digital currencies that lost an estimated $40 billion in 2022, was set to appear in U.S. court on Thursday to face criminal fraud charges after being extradited from Montenegro this week.
articles.title: Former crypto executive Do Kwon due in US court on criminal fraud charges

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Commerce Department said on Thursday it is considering new rules that would impose restrictions on Chinese drones that would restrict or ban them in the United States citing national security concerns.
articles.title: US considers potential rules to restrict or bar Chinese drones
